readHR module¶

class readHR.EcgReader(file)¶

Bases: object

data_check()¶

This method takes in the time and voltage arrays and ensures that the data type for every element is a float.

Returns:If a particular element in time or voltage is not a float,

the function will raise “Error: Time vector is wrong data type”.

Returns:self.data_type is a True if numeric and False if any entries are

strings. If data_type is False, some of the remaining initialization steps will not be performed.

Returns:self.is_valid_file is True
file_check()¶

This method takes in ECG data from a CSV file inputted by the user, and checks that it is the correct file format.

Returns:If the file is not a CSV, the function will raise

“Error: File is not a .csv”. For CSV files, the initialization will move on to the next step.

find_range(peak_thresh=0.9, base_thresh=0.1)¶

This method determines the range of what is considered as a heartbeat, then determines the time values at which a heartbeat occurs.

Parameters:peak_thresh – Ratio of ranges used to detect peaks. Default is

0.9 V.

Parameters:base_thresh – Base threshold value to reset between peaks.

Default is 0.1 V.

Returns:This method appends the resulting time values associated with heart beats onto an array called peak_vector.
read_file()¶

This method reads the contents of the csv file and attempts to convert numeric strings into floats before adding to time and voltage vectors.

Returns:Time and voltage vectors with each entry from columns in the

original csv file.

Heart Rate Monitor
